New Records: Lonzo Ball scored 10 points in his first NBA action in almost three years
Key Match Events: Lonzo Ball nailed an open 3-pointer from the left corner off a feed from Nikola Vucevic
Several players expressed their support and respect for Ball in the team's postgame meeting
Pre-Game Insights: Ball said he will 'for sure' play against the Cavaliers
He will start the season on a minutes restriction and won't play games on back-to-back days
Post-Match Reflections: Ball said he felt a lot better playing than watching
He couldn't even really put into words how he felt out there
Ball gave credit to his teammates and coaches for their support
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ball got a rousing ovation when he subbed in for Josh Giddey
The Bulls had Ball on a 16-minute limit against Minnesota
Ball said he got a new meniscus to go with the cartilage transplant
Others: Ball's tenure in Chicago got off to a good start following a sign-and-trade deal with New Orleans prior to the 2021-22 season
